author: sky.cactus
content: We *would* need a `base_fee` field for each of the  units in the block header, but assuming they all followed EIP-1559 style I think that is the only new header field per new pricing unit.

author: sky.cactus
content: And you would always be able to calculate the price from the previous block.  With a second item in the header per unit we could narrow that to requiring only the parent header (not the body).

author: sky.cactus
content: It feels like this would scale with `n-dimensional` pricing pretty well, and is generalized enough that it should be able to work with any new pricing mechanics we may want in the future.

author: sky.cactus
content: And the overhead here seems small enough to be worth it IMO.

author: bridge-bot
content: <adietrichs> right, I think I generally agree

author: bridge-bot
content: <inphi> re: blob tx fees. We should keep in mind that, unlike eip-1559, the network incurs the cost of blob storage and distribution. There's no fast sync analog for blob distribution. All participating nodes have to make blobs available or get penalized. So we should establish bandwidth limits that the network can tolerate, and then target some measure _less than_ the limit.

author: sky.cactus
content: *target some measure less than half the limit (since worst case scenario we can end up with 2x over some arbitrary period of time).

author: bridge-bot
content: <inphi> yeah makes sense

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Random 4844 thought: have the clients considered supporting an argument to let us store the blobs in a different path than the main data?  It'd be nice to be able to host that on cheaper HDDs instead of SSDs since I assume the latency wouldn't be as big of a factor?  Or would that potentially make DAS too slow?

author: protolambda
content: Clients are not that far yet to start optimizing, but what you suggest is definitely possible, good idea.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: Yup I recognize clients are still very early in development, but wanted to mention it now before I forgot especially if it influences any client devs that are just starting on implementation to considering storing the blobs separately from the rest of the chain state to facilitate this. ðŸ™‚
